titles: A proper new ballad, shewing a merrie iest of one Ieamie of Woodicock Hill, and his wife, how he espied through a doore, one making of him cuckold, and how that for lucre of money, he was well contented therewith. To be sung to a new tune, called Woodicocks Hill
notes: In verse - "One Iemie there was that dwelt in a towne,".
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Humor --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Humor --  Early works to 1800.
